projects.title: Vector Control in Permanent Magnet Synchronous Motors (PMSM)
projects.description:
This project was a preliminary study for my master thesis. The main objective was to grasp a full understanding of the control of electrical machinery, particularly in a PMSM drive. A zero-pole cancellation was used to demonstrate the vector control scheme, but not intended to show the best controller design. The system response is verified for steady-state and transient operation by circuit simulations in PLECS Blockset 4.3.6. In the next step, the possibility to develop a control scheme for shrinking the DC-link capacitance in electric drives will be developed. 

Project type:
• Internship

Keyword:
• Vector control, Coordinate transformation, Cascaded control system, PI-controller.

projects.title: Machine Learning for Power Grids
projects.description:
We took the advantage of having a summer school at ESADE, Barcelona for molding our student project in KTH into a feasible start-up idea under ESADE's guidance. Our key features were real-time monitoring, grid reliability improvement, and fault diagnosis. Our product is a solution, i.e. software or platforms. A simple and quick market test was conducted by contacting the grid's players and pitching our idea throughout a phone call. The result shows that one of the Mexican TSO showed an interest, yet a further test must be performed.

Project type:
• Business development.

projects.title: Predictive Maintenance in Air-Core Reactor
projects.description:
One of the biggest challenges in the power industry is the uncertainty of failure rates in electrical equipment installed on the network. Some equipment may have a shorter lifetime, while the rest could work for much longer than expected. To tackle this uncertainty, we decided to introduce a machine learning model for probabilistic prediction on failure rates of the components using historical network data incorporated with technical specifications and other supporting indicators.

Project type:
• Information and technology solution.

Maturity level:
• Prototype.

projects.title: Precharge and Discharge Board
projects.description:
Responsible for designing precharge and discharge mechanism for eV15 Electric Vehicle KTH-FS. The precharge circuit works to assure the current during a power transfer process from the battery to the inverter-fed motor does not exceed its maximum limit. The idea is to place a charging resistor in between the battery and the inverter to limit the surge current due to potential differences. As soon as the voltage of the DC-link capacitor exceeds a certain value, the current path is switched into a resistor-free path. The discharge circuit is implemented by putting a normally closed contactor in parallel with the DC-link capacitor to remove the residual voltage after the car is being turned off.  

Project type:
• Extracurricular activities.

projects.title: Mahakam 2x10 MWp Solar Power Installations
projects.description:
As an archipelago country, Indonesia has an imbalance in electricity development across the islands. This project was initiated to supply the electricity demand in Borneo, as well as an effort to provide a higher share of renewable generation. Two preliminary studies were conducted: a feasibility study using PVSyst, and an interconnection study using ETAP and DIgSILENT.

Project type:
• Renewable energy.

projects.title: Static test bench
projects.description:
A static test bench to test the parameters and performance of the motor for the research and development purposes in electric vehicles (EV). The set-up can be operated as a motor or a load according to the testing specifications. Supporting equipment are BLDC motors, induction motors, braking and cooling systems, and InstaSPIN Motor Control.

Project type:
• Science and engineering.

projects.title: Design and Analysis in Implementation of Neutral Point Clamped Inverter using Space Vector Pulse Width Modulation (SVPWM)
projects.description: A bachelor thesis project in Institut Teknologi Bandung (ITB). Working in a team of two, our objective was to design and realize a grid-connected inverter by implementing Space Vector Pulse Width Modulation (SVPWM) in a three-level three-phase inverter. A Neutral Point Clamped topology was used and the hardware was designed to have a 2.5 kVA rating. The control algorithm was designed in Simulink and the implementation was done in FPGA.

profile_positions.description:
• Ensure and improve the quality and validation of EVBox's products by designing, writing, and executing testing scenarios.
• Relevance fields: OCPP protocol, connectivity testing, and Linux-based testing.
profile_positions.title: Junior Quality Assurance and Testing Engineer

profile_positions.description:
• Doing my master's thesis on developing control algorithms to improve the efficiency and lifetime of motor drives in household appliances. 
• Investigate the possibilities to find energy buffer alternatives to replace a bulky DC-link capacitor.
• Two proposed solutions: utilized the rotor's kinetic energy, or stored it as magnetic current on the winding.
profile_positions.title: Research and Development Intern

profile_positions.description:
A program from InnoEnergy to give the opportunity for the SENSE students to work on real-world challenges set by industry partners. 

Worked in a team to develop artificial intelligence (AI) algorithm for predicting the failure rates of Air-Core Reactor in ABB SVCs (Static VAR Compensator) system.
With the main responsibilities are:
• Developed a network model for assigning training data sets to AI algorithms.
• Assisted the software team in interpreting the results from the stability perspective.
profile_positions.title: Industrial Innovation Project

profile_positions.description:
Worked as a powertrain engineer for the KTH Formula Student (KTH-FS) team in Formula
Student Germany 2019 and Formula SAE Italy 2019.
With the main responsibilities are:
• Developed the precharge and discharge mechanism, a feature that is performed in every starting and turning off the car to ensure a safe power transfer process.
• Worked on circuit and PCBs design, setting up a test environment, and assuring overall system safety and reliability.
profile_positions.title: Powertrain Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Worked in an engineering consultant which provides renewable energy solutions in Indonesia.
With the main responsibilities:
• Calculated energy yield assessment of solar power plant installation in various sites.
• Worked on interconnection study on existing local networks and proposed the required products, processes, and equipment for compliance based on predefined standards
• Conducted site visits for the first-phase engineering assessment, i.e., generation of load curve characteristics, ground resistances, and solar irradiation data.

Projects under responsibility were Bima system (300 kWp), Berau system (200 kWp), and Mahakam system (2x10 MWp).
profile_positions.title: Energy Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Worked as an engineer in a state-owned company for electronics products and solutions. Joined a Research and Development (RnD) team that focuses on electric vehicle development.
With three major responsibilities:
• Proposed a design scheme for the driverless vehicle project in port applications and summarized the internal and external issues related to product development.
• Worked on the realization of an electric motor test bench for testing applications.
• Assisted the RnD manager in drafting legal documents, project planning, and funding proposals.
profile_positions.title: Electrical Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Assisted junior and sophomore students in doing their module in the laboratory, including tutorial sessions, preliminary lab tests, assignments, and evaluating their reports.

Laboratory courses under responsibilities:
• Power Electronics (power switches, rectifier, inverter, and DC-DC converter applications)
• Electric Circuits (passive elements, DC and AC power, filters, and transistors)
• Electric Machines (DC machines, AC machines, and transformers)
• Basic Physics (superposition, electromagnetic field, AC power, and RLC circuit)

volunteer_experiences.description:
EnergiTalk is a podcast in Bahasa Indonesia. It focuses on the science and technology field, particularly in emerging topics such as smart grid, electric vehicle, and energy storage. The main objective is as a discussion channel between the Indonesian students—who are currently pursuing further education abroad—and energy enthusiasts. Our speakers come from different backgrounds and specializations. For example, Ph.D. researcher, MSc. student alumni, and professional and energy experts.

Host and Co-Founder: Adrian Dewanto and Darian Verdy
Available in Spotify, Google Podcast, Anchor, Breaker, and Soundcloud.

Link:
http://open.spotify.com/show/7nkU7cRDfEBUPJed50jROy

A mentor in a student-led community that provides an incubator for the enthusiast, motivated individual, to gather, share, and inspire each other-from students to students- in Bandung, aimed to help 1st to 3rd-year college students to achieve more: be high-achievers, start a business, or start building NGOs to contribute to society.

volunteer_experiences.description: Worked intensively with a team of fifteen students. Our main goal was to maintain a relationship with external parties.

Responsibility:
• Appointed as a Group Leader, responsible for leading a team consists of 15 volunteers.

A charity event at Sekolah Pendidikan Luar Biasa Bagian C (School for Disabled People) in Bandung, Indonesia. Worked in a team responsible for designing the whole event based on a spirit of togetherness and educational games.
